Package ch.ascendise.Validator

Class AbstractValidator

java.lang.Object
ch.ascendise.Validator.AbstractValidator
All Implemented Interfaces:
Validator
Direct Known Subclasses:
EmailValidator, LengthValidator, NotBlankValidator, NotEmptyValidator, NotNullValidator, RangeValidator, RegexValidator
public abstract class AbstractValidator extends Object implements Validator
AbstractValidator is the abstract base classed used for implementing custom validators. This validator handles one field of an object.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AbstractValidator(Object object, String fieldName, Annotation annotation)
    Constructor should not be called explicitly It only gets used by the factory instanciating all validators of the object to be validated.

  • Constructor Details

    • AbstractValidator

      public AbstractValidator(Object object, String fieldName, Annotation annotation)
      Constructor should not be called explicitly It only gets used by the factory instanciating all validators of the object to be validated.
      Parameters:
      object - Value that gets validated
      fieldName - Name of the field that gets validated. Can and should be used for error messages.
      annotation - Annotation that identifies which validator is used and might hold values needed for validation

  • Method Details

      Value of the object that is validated
      Returns:

      public String getFieldName()
      Name of the field that is validated
      Returns:
      Name of field to be validated

    • getAnnotation

      public Annotation getAnnotation()
      Annotation that specifies how the field is validated and includes all the values for constraints. e.g. Length-Annotation with values for min and max length
      Returns:
      Validation annotation
